remarks: It takes two different points to form a line.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 6-Aug-2019.)
statement:
tglngval.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglngval.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglngval.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglngval.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tglngval.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. P ) $.
tglngval.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. P ) $.
tglngne.1 $e |- ( ph -> Z e. ( X L Y ) ) $.
tglngne $p |- ( ph -> X =/= Y ) $.
